I think the lighting glitches are caused by height map transparency not being 50%. Kopernicus exported normal, however, is already set to 50%. Also, for memory usage, I would recommend making all the normals into greyscale. you can do that with Gimp2 (what I also use as primary planet texture editor) selecting greyscale in the "image" panel. You can also do that with photoshop but I don't use it so I have no knoledge of how to do that. Cheers and wish me luck!

Well, i have the height map:

![oNbZpWm.png](http://imgur.com/oNbZpWm.png)

It was generated using an assortment of VertexHeightNoises and VertexSimplexHeightAbsolutes, and then exported at 2048x1024 and used in a VertexHeightMap, to save the game from computing 4-5 cpu intensive noise functions every time some terrain is generated, and to help with the buggyness of Kopernicus.
